briefdescription.para: Create and initialize an NFC NDEF TNEP Application message descriptor.

detaileddescription.para: Use the macro NFC_NDEF_MSG to access the NDEF message descriptor instance. This macro reserves place for the TNEP status record.

parameterdescription.para: Name of the related instance.
Maximum count of records in the message.

memberdef.name: NFC_TNEP_TAG_SERVICE_DEF
memberdef.initializer: \ BUILD_ASSERT(_t_wait <= NFC_TNEP_TAG_MAX_WAIT_TIME, \ "The Waiting time has to be equal or smaller than 63"); \ BUILD_ASSERT(_n_wait <= NFC_TNEP_TAG_MAX_WAIT_TIME, \ "The Waiting time extension count has to be equal or smaller then 15"); \ \ NFC_TNEP_SERIVCE_PARAM_RECORD_DESC_DEF(_name, NFC_TNEP_VERSION, \ _uri_length, _uri, \ _mode, _t_wait, _n_wait, \ _max_msg_size); \ static const struct nfc_tnep_tag_service_cb _name##_cb = { \ .selected = _select_cb, \ .deselected = _deselect_cb, \ .message_received = _message_cb, \ .error_detected = _error_cb, \ }; \ \ const STRUCT_SECTION_ITERABLE(nfc_tnep_tag_service, _name##_svc) = \ NFC_TNEP_TAG_SERVICE(_name)

detaileddescription.para: TNEP Service instance contains information about Services Parameter and callback s for NDEF application. The Service Parameter contains the Service Name URI of the Service and the TNEP parameters used to communicate with the Service. The Reader/Writer will configure the TNEP communication according to the announced parameter in the Service Parameter record.

parameterdescription.para: Service instance name used in code. Use NFC_TNEP_TAG_SERVICE to get service by name.
Service Name URI.
Service Name URI length in bytes.
Service mode - TNEP Communication Mode: Single Response or Service specific

Minimum Waiting Time measured between the end of the last write command of an NDEF Write Procedure and the start of the first command of the first NDEF Read Procedure following the NDEF Write Procedures. T_wait has a value between 0 and 63 and is converted to time units using protocol specified formula.
Maximum Number of Waiting Time Extensions is the maximum number of requested waiting time extensions n_wait for a specific Service. N_wait can vary between 0 and 15 repetitions.
Maximum NDEF message size in bytes.
Callback function, called by protocol library when service is selected by the Reader/Writer.
Callback function, called by protocol library when service is deselected by the Reader/Writer.
Callback function, called by protocol library when new message is received from the Reader/Writer.
Callback function, called by protocol library when an internal error occurred.

briefdescription.para: macro for accessing the TNEP Service.
Callback type for encoding the Initial TNEP NDEF message.

detaileddescription.para: This callback is called every time when the TNEP NDEF library encodes the Initial TNEP message. You must use nfc_tnep_initial_msg_encode function to finish encoding.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the Initial TNEP NDEF message.
If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

detaileddescription.para: TNEP Tag Device needs two buffers one for current NDEF message and seconds for new message.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to NDEF message buffer.
Pointer to swap NDEF message buffer.
Length of NDEF message buffers.
If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.
TNEP Tag Events.
Event count. This library needs 2 events.

Function for setting NDEF data for NFC TNEP Tag Device. This library use it internally to set raw NDEF message to the Tag NDEF file. This function is called from atomic context, so sleeping or anyhow delaying is not allowed there.
If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Create the Initial TNEP NDEF message.

detaileddescription.para: This function creates the Initial TNEP message. Initial NDEF message has to contain at least one service parameters record defined using NFC_TNEP_TAG_SERVICE_DEF. It can also contain optional NDEF records which can be used by NFC Poller Device which does not support TNEP Protocol.

parameterdescription.para: Maximum count of the optional NDEF records
Callback function for encoding the Initial TNEP NDEF message. Can be set to NULL if max_record_cnt is 0 then only the Service Parameters Records are encoded into the Initial TNEP NDEF message.
If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct nfc_ndef_msg_desc *msg, const struct nfc_ndef_record_desc *records, size_t records_cnt)
memberdef.name: nfc_tnep_initial_msg_encode

detaileddescription.para: This function encodes the Initial TNEP NDEF message. It must be used in combination with initial_msg_encode_t callback function.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the Initial NDEF message descriptor. NDEF records can be added to it also before calling this function.
Pointer to the first NDEF records structure. Can be set to NULL if there are no additional NDEF records to encode or records are encoded directly to the Initial NDEF message.
Number of provided NDEF records. It must be set to 0 when records is NULL.
If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Waiting for a signals to execute protocol logic.

detaileddescription.para: This function must be called periodically from thread to process the TNEP Tag Device.

simplesect.para: This function cannot be called before nfc_tnep_init().

briefdescription.para: Indicate about new TNEP message available in buffer.

detaileddescription.para: The NFC Tag Device concludes that the NDEF Write Procedure is finished when, after a write command of the NDEF Write Procedure, an NDEF message is available in the data area. If, after the write command of the NDEF Write Procedure, no NDEF message is available in the data area, the NFC Tag Device concludes that the actual NDEF Write Procedure is ongoing.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to NDEF message buffer.
Length of NDEF message buffer.

briefdescription.para: Add application data record to next message.

detaileddescription.para: Use this function to set application data after the service selection to set service application data and use it also during service data exchange with the NFC Polling Device. To indicate that application has no more data use nfc_tnep_tag_tx_msg_no_app_data().

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to NDEF message with application data. The message must have at least one free slot for the TNEP status record which is added automatically by this function. So if you want to encode for example 2 NDEF records the NDEF message minimal record count is 3. Use NFC_TNEP_TAG_APP_MSG_DEF which reserves slot for the TNEP status record.
TNEP App data message status.
If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

briefdescription.para: Respond with no more application data.

detaileddescription.para: If the NDEF application on the NFC Tag Device has finished, and therefore the NFC Tag Device has no more application data available for the Reader/Writer, then the NFC Tag Device SHALL provide a status message containing a single record that is a TNEP status record indicating success.

parameterdescription.para: If the operation was successful. Otherwise, a (negative) error code is returned.

detaileddescription.para: If data exchange with poller starts again, NFC TNEP Tag device shall provide TNEP Initial message.

briefdescription.para: Get the NFC Tag TNEP service count.
